title: How has technology made it easier to communicate? - Quora

response.answer_text: well you will get my old fashioned answer, tech has made long distance communication easier but letters or snail mail was something! writing a letter was somehow more meaningful and the waiting for the answer or receiving a letter was a surprise of it s own. Now in the day to day communication with close by people technology hasn't done us any favors. You can observe yourself in restaurant for exemple families sharing a meal but busy texting to someone else on their devices! this is very anti communication. It is easier for people nowadays to text than actually move and go see their friends or relatives, this isn't a very good communication habit. Communicating through texts is totally without feelings or emotions compared to actually go see the person you would want to talk to, spend some time together, share an activity and talk about what needed to be said. So no technology isnt making communication better, i would actually say it made it worse

Technology makes communication possible wherever you are. It simply overcoming barriers between islands and continents. As I remember before it is really hard to be far away from your family but now its easier to check on them 24/7through the newest technology such as the internet and smartphones. You cannot just message them but also see them through a video call. With the wide access to technology, you can even work at home and just facilitate face to face contact with your employers. Technology is also making it cost-effective for some businesses that wanted to hire employees outside their countries since they can conduct an interview online. Aside from that you can render very good customer service through chat and call through the use of technology.
